identificationModule.briefTitle: Reducing Surgical Site Infection Rates Using an Alternative Sternal Dressing
identificationModule.officialTitle: Reducing Surgical Site Infection Rates Using an Alternative Sternal Dressing

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study will evaluate two alternative dressings compared to a standard Island dressing presently in use at Stanford Hospital to determine reductions in surgical site infection (SSI) rates among cardiac surgery patients. Cardiovascular surgery patients who will have a sternotomy incision as a routine part of their surgery will be approached to voluntarily participate. Participants will be randomized to one of three dressing to determine which dressing has the lowest rate of sternal wound infection. The investigators will also assess the impact of alternative dressing use on hospital 30-day readmission rates related to SSI.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Participant randomly assigned to either a control or one of two intervention groups

armGroups.label: Dressing 1: Standard Island Dressing
armGroups.description: Standard dressing that is applied on most patients with a sternotomy wound incision immediately after cardiovascular surgery before leaving the operating room. Dressing will be removed 48 hours after surgery.

armGroups.label: Dressing 2: Prevena negative pressure
armGroups.description: Prevena negative pressure wound suction machine dressing applied to sternotomy wound incision immediately after cardiovascular surgery. Dressing will be in use for 7 days or removed sooner if participant is discharged before end of 7 day post-operative time period.
interventionNames: Device: Prevena Negative Pressure wound dressing

armGroups.label: Dressing 3: Mepilex Border Post-Op Ag
armGroups.description: Mepilex Border PostOp AG dressing impregnated with silver ions. Dressing will be in use for 7 days or removed earlier if patient is discharged before end of 7 days post0operative time period.

interventions.name: Standard Island Dressing
interventions.description: participant randomized to control group before end of surgery to be applied on cardiovascular heart surgical sternal incision.

interventions.name: Prevena Negative Pressure wound dressing
interventions.description: participant randomized to dressing before end of surgery to be applied on cardiovascular heart surgical sternal incision.

interventions.name: Mepilex Border Post-Op Ag
interventions.description: Participant randomized to dressing before end of surgery to be applied on cardiovascular heart surgical sternal incision

primaryOutcomes.measure: Rates of surgical site infection pertaining to each dressing studied.
primaryOutcomes.description: evaluate alternative dressings to determine reductions in surgical site infection (SSI) rates among cardiac surgery patients
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From Post-Operative date 0 to 7th day or earlier which ever day comes first.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Impact of alternative dressings on rates of Sternal wound incision infection
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assess the impact of alternative dressing use on hospital 30-day readmission rates related to surgical site infection (SSI).

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Participants who will undergo cardiac surgery via a sternotomy incision.Inclusion criteria will be patients having surgical valve, CABGs, aortic dissection, myectomy and myotomy, Cox MAZE, Myocardial bridge Un-roofing

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients undergoing heart transplants, Ventricular Assist Device (VAD), with postoperative courses complicated by tamponade, take-backs, and open chest incisions will also be excluded.
